sect2.title: Writing to the Zend Server Monitor
sect2.para: Zend_Log_Writer_ZendMonitor allows you to log events via Zend Server's Monitor API. This allows you to aggregate log messages for your entire application environment in a single location. Internally, it simply uses the monitor_custom_event() function from the Zend Monitor API.

One particularly useful feature of the Monitor API is that it allows you to specify arbitrary custom information alongside the log message. For instance, if you wish to log an exception, you can log not just the exception message, but pass the entire exception object to the function, and then inspect the object within the Zend Server event monitor.

note.title: Zend Monitor must be installed and enabled
note.para: In order to use this log writer, Zend Monitor must be both installed and enabled. However, it is designed such that if Zend Monitor is not detected, it will simply act as a null logger.

The second parameter may be a scalar, object, or array; if you need to pass multiple pieces of information, the best way to do so is to pass an associative array.
Within Zend Server, your event is logged as a "custom event". From the "Monitor" tab, select the "Events" sub-item, and then filter on "Custom" to see custom events.

note.title: Integration with Zend_Application
note.para: The ZendMonitor log writer has a corresponding Zend_Application bootstrap resource. If you create your project using the zf.sh or zf.bat command, this resource will be registered for you by default, and used in your ErrorController to log application exceptions.
